text: - I can't believe I got my dream job
off of, right after grad school.
Like this is just unreal.

People spend years trying
to find their dream job.
And I'm like, I'm doing it right now

but it's because I get
to wear different hats.
I get to be a programmer.
I get to be a salesperson.
I get to be in finance.
I get to do marketing.

Sometimes I feel like even
a lawyer as I'm in meetings,
trying to defend a point or argue a point.

- If you look at the role of
a technical product manager,
technical is one part of it.

There is design, there
is product strategy,
and then there is marketing.

So all of it encompasses a
good technical product manager.

- Before AWS, I was working
as a software engineer.
I studied electrical engineering

and then I decided to get an
MBA because I did wanna pivot
into this product management role where,

kind of my technical
expertise can cross over

with some of the things
that I really love to do

and kind of get into the
business sense of product.

- So the most important
skill that I'm looking

for in a technical product
manager is curiosity.

I do not expect them
to write a perfect code
or even write a code

but I do expect them to be
curious enough to understand

if I switch my TV on and I
see a Prime Video come up,
what goes on behind the screen?

Even if you don't have a
strong technical background,
do make sure that you leverage

all the other impressive
things you might have done
in the past

and that's gonna make you a
great technical product manager.

- If you wanna prove to
yourself and if you'll learn

about what you're capable of,
this is the place to do it.
I do not believe there's any other place

that control your true
potential other than Amazon.
